intro: Lindernia stictantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Lindernia stictantha is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
